user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_generic_dev_dma_unmap:
```c
void metal_generic_dev_dma_unmap(struct metal_bus *bus,
				 struct metal_device *device,
				 uint32_t dir,
				 struct metal_sg *sg,
				 int nents)
{
	int i;
	(void)bus;
	(void)device;
	(void)dir;

	for (i = 0; i < nents; i++) {
		metal_cache_invalidate(sg[i].virt, sg[i].len);
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_generic_dev_dma_unmap:
struct metal_device {
	const char             *name;       /**< Device name */
	struct metal_bus       *bus;        /**< Bus that contains device */
	unsigned int           num_regions; /**< Number of I/O regions in
						 device */
	struct metal_io_region regions[METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS]; /**< Array of
							I/O regions in device*/
	struct metal_list      node;       /**< Node on bus' list of devices */
	int                    irq_num;    /**< Number of IRQs per device */
	void                   *irq_info;  /**< IRQ ID */
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No code fragment in the provided function is provably unreachable. Reasoning:
- There are no unconditional branches (return, goto, break out of function) preceding any statements that would make them unreachable.
- The (void)bus; (void)device; (void)dir; expressions are valid reachable statements used to suppress unused-parameter warnings; they are not unreachable.
- The for loop body (metal_cache_invalidate(...)) is reachable whenever nents > 0; nothing in the function or the provided related definitions makes nents always non-positive, so the loop body cannot be classified as unreachable.
- There are no compile-time conditionals (#if/#else) or constant false conditions in the snippet that would render code unreachable.
Therefore, based on the provided code and related definitions, there are no fragments that need investigation for MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.1 (unreachable code).
